newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-ASPRILLA HITS TWO AS NEWCASTLE OPEN WITH WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ASPRILLA HITS TWO AS NEWCASTLE OPEN WITH WIN.

text.p: Colombian international striker Faustino Asprilla scored twice on Saturday to give Newcastle a winning start to the new English season and make up for injured Alan Shearer's absence.

Asprilla scored the fastest goal of the day as last season's runners-up beat Sheffield Wednesday 2-1 at St James' Park, grabbing the first after one minute 48 seconds and the second in the 72nd minute.
Liverpool, the favourites to replace Manchester United as champions, made a shaky start at Wimbledon despite strong performances from new signings Paul Ince and German international KarlHeinz Riedle.
Marcus Gayle put Wimbledon ahead in the 55th minute before Michael Owen equalised from a penalty.
Chelsea and Arsenal, two London clubs who have dominated transfer talk over the summer, had mixed fortunes. Chelsea lost 3-2 at Coventry and Arsenal drew 1-1 at former manager George Graham's Leeds.
Newcomers Barnsley, in the top flight for the first time in their 110-year history, took an early lead but lost 2-1 at home to West Ham.
Manchester United play Tottenham on Sunday.
